def.dt: :a container usually made by weaving together long thin pieces of material wicker/straw/wire baskets a fruit basket = a basket filled with fruit a laundry basket [=a basket that holds dirty clothes] They brought their lunch in a picnic basket. see also breadbasket handbasket wastebasket
:the amount contained in a basket a basket [=basketful] of eggs
:a net hanging from a thin metal ring that the ball must go through in order to score points His shot missed the basket completely.
:a successful shot She made/scored a basket. [=she scored points by making a shot that went through the basket]

dro.dre: put all your eggs in one basket

def.dt: :a person who is very nervous, tired, etc., and is not able to think or act normally I was so worried about losing my job that I was a complete basket case.
:something (such as a company or a government) that is in very bad condition and close to failure a business that was once very successful but is now a financial basket case
:a hard-shelled oval thing from which a young bird is born The egg will hatch about 10 days after it is laid.
:an oval or round thing from which a snake, frog, insect, etc., is born

:the egg of a bird (especially a chicken) eaten as food count poached/fried/boiled eggs hard-boiled/soft-boiled eggs the smell of rotten eggs (US) scrambled eggs I bought a carton of eggs. (US) They served us bacon and eggs for breakfast. = (Brit) They served us eggs and bacon for breakfast. an Easter egg [=an egg that is specially decorated at Easter] noncount (Brit) scrambled egg a batter made from flour and egg egg white(s)/yolk
:a cell that is produced by the female sexual organs and that combines with the male's sperm in reproduction The egg is fertilized by the sperm. called also ovum
:something that is shaped like a bird's egg a chocolate egg
:someone who does bad things He was dishonest, but he was the only bad egg in the group.

dt.snote: If you have egg on your face you appear foolish, usually because something that you said would happen has not happened. The unexpected election result left a lot of journalists with egg on their faces.

def.dt: :a likeable person I've known Jim for years. He's a good egg.
:to fail completely :to fail in a very obvious or embarrassing way He used to be a very popular star, but his last two movies have laid an egg.

dro.dre: put all your eggs in one basket

dt.snote: If you put all your eggs in one basket, you risk all you have on the success or failure of one thing (such as an investment), so that if something goes wrong you could lose everything. Investors should diversify their investments instead of putting all their eggs in one basket. [=instead of investing all their money in one company or one kind of company]

dro.dre: the goose that lays the golden egg
